page.title: 09TREE SURVEY
page.content: There are quite a few species of tree around school. Around the mansion and along the drive there are at least 12 different species. Many were planted by the Minet family from (1900) and some are even older. These trees include Wellingtonias which are now 50 metres, Horse Chestnuts 30m as well as Cedars, Corsican Pines and Scots Pines. Lime trees are well represented as in the 1950's an avenue of elms down the drive were replaced by 20 Lime trees, these are now 10m high. The newest tree is a disease resistant elm which is part of Pitney Bowes Elms across Europe project; an attempt to replace some of the lost elms. It has a 50 year diary to chart its progress. Based on a survey by Karin Chudley 1H
